frame.name: Institutions
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame concerns permanent organizations (the <fen>Institution</fen>s) with a public character, meaning that they are intended to affect the lives of the public at large in a particular <fen>Domain</fen>. In some cases, most or all members of the public have a direct relationship with the <fen>Institution</fen>, but in many cases, the effect on the populace is indirect.
<ex><fex name="Institution">This</fex> is an <fex name="dom">academic</fex> <t>institution</t> <fex name="Members">comprised largely of entrepreneurs</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Institution
FE.definition: <def-root>A permanent organization with a socially important purpose.</def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition: <def-root>The concern of the <fen>Institution</fen>-- broadly speaking, the aspect of society that they affect.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The goal of the <fen>Institution</fen>.
<ex>We're trying to figure out the quality indicators of an <t>institution</t> <fex name="pur">for addiction care</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Members
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individuals that make up an <fen>Institution</fen>.
<ex>We are an <t>institution</t> <fex name="mem">of primarily academic personnel</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: institution.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an organization founded for a religious, educational, or social purpose.

lexUnit.name: institutional.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of, in, or like an institution.
